Dopo vari passaggi procedurali, che tralascio, il TAR Lazio, con la sentenza n. 11040 del 28/10/2020, ha respinto il ricorso con istanza cautelare di alcuni medici per l’annullamento dei provvedimenti emessi dall’Agenzia del Farmaco e dalla Regione Lazio in merito all’utilizzo della idrossiclorochina e di altri farmaci per i malati di Covid-19. I ricorrenti avevano considerato illegittimo il fatto che l’Agenzia del Farmaco e la Regione, pur ammettendo l’utilizzo di tali farmaci per detta patologia, ne subordinassero tuttavia l’impiego all’attestazione della patologia stessa attraverso un tampone positivo e reiterato, compromettendo in questo modo la tempestività e l’efficacia delle cure. Nella sentenza si legge peraltro che la Regione, nella propria memoria, ha dichiarato: “il rilievo è comunque superato con la nota 382588 del 28-04-2020 che consente la suddetta prescrizione sotto la diretta responsabilità del clinico prescrittore seppur in assenza di tampone positivo, proprio in virtù di uno spazio innegabile di discrezionalità scientifica nell'erogare la prestazione in scienza e coscienza e per l'innegabile diretta conoscenza del paziente". Se le parole hanno un senso, questa dichiarazione della Regione Lazio significa che i medici prescrittori, anche non specialisti, possono utilizzare i farmaci sopra indicati senza sottoporre il paziente al tampone. Non solo, la stessa AIFA, in una sua memoria, ha ammesso di non aver mai inteso limitare la libertà del singolo medico di prescrivere off label il farmaco, riaffermando quindi implicitamente il principio dell’autonomia e della responsabilità del medico nel prescrivere una cura che egli ritenga appropriata per i suoi pazienti.

Per quanto sopra, non appare quindi immotivata la decisione del TAR, il quale ha dichiarato inammissibile il ricorso cautelare per “carenza di interesse”. La decisione è stata comunque impugnata dinanzi al Consiglio di Stato, che ha rimesso la causa e il definitivo giudizio di merito allo stesso TAR.

Ritengo in ogni caso che il TAR non potrà sovvertire nel merito quanto ha già accertato nel giudizio cautelare sulla base delle memorie di AIFA e Regione Lazio, vale a dire che i medici di base potranno prescrivere ai propri pazienti, sia la idrossiclorochina che gli altri farmaci in esame, rivelatisi efficaci anche per la cura iniziale del Covid-19.

Oups voici la posologie pour la chloroquine:
Information sur la chloroquine (Aralen®)
Votre itinéraire de voyage comprend un séjour dans une zone où sévit le paludisme (appelé aussi malaria). Le paludisme est une source importante de maladie et de mortalité à l’étranger. Il s’agit d’une infection du sang causée par des parasites nommés Plasmodium qui sont transmis par une piqûre de moustiques.

Il est possible de prévenir le paludisme par la prise régulière de médicaments. Comme aucun médicament n’est efficace à 100 %, il est important de vous protéger des piqûres de moustiques : utilisez un chasse-moustique à base de DEET, dormez sous une moustiquaire (de préférence imprégnée de permethrine), évitez les produits de beauté parfumés, portez des vêtements longs et de couleur pâle et évitez les sorties nocturnes. Ces mesures sont aussi importantes que la prise de comprimés.

La chloroquine (Aralen®) vous est recommandée selon la posologie suivante :

Adultes :

2 comprimés de 250 mg par semaine.
Enfants :

< 10 kg : 1/4 comprimé/sem.
10-19 kg : 1/2 comprimé/sem.
20-30 kg : 1 comprimé/sem.
31-45 kg : 1 1/2 comprimé/sem.
≥ 46 kg : dose adulte
Les comprimés devraient être pris en même temps, toujours le même jour de la semaine, de préférence juste après un repas pour en faciliter la digestion. On doit commencer la médication une semaine avant le départ et la poursuivre durant le séjour et jusqu’à quatre semaines après le retour. La chloroquine est sécuritaire pour la femme enceinte et le nourrisson. Les comprimés peuvent être écrasés et mélangés à de la nourriture pour en faciliter la prise.

Effets secondaires

La majorité des voyageurs ne présentent aucun effet secondaire. À l’occasion, des maux d’estomac, des démangeaisons et des troubles visuels peuvent survenir. Ces effets sont en général mineurs et cesseront dès l’arrêt de la médication. On peut les atténuer en fractionnant la dose en deux prises à 3 ou 4 jours d’intervalle (par exemple, 1 comprimé le lundi et 1 comprimé le jeudi).

En cas de fièvre

Malgré la prise d’une médication préventive, tout épisode aigu de fièvre pendant le séjour à l’étranger ou les mois qui suivent le retour peut être un signe de paludisme. Le voyageur doit alors consulter immédiatement un médecin et l’informer de son séjour récent en zone tropicale.

It would be sensible take his results seriously...and the effective use of chloroquin and hydroxychloroquin against corona viruses was well known and published in the wake of SARS and MERS... this hasn't been worked on much since... and the US Govt pulled money out of the medical research into viruses and the pioneering of possible treatments for same well before the 2016 election... otherwise we might not have been in quite as bigger mess as we currently are...you may want to check on the French results again and perhaps revise your reporting just a little bit. Both these are old established drugs and off patent. If they do work as well as the latest trial that the French are reporting there would be not much profit for the  multinational pharmaceutical corporations but at least their production could be freely ramped up to industrial wartime levels and it would be comparatively cheap to do so. The Italians not to be outdone are claiming that the pairing of a more modern and still proprietary anti-inflammatory which is used against gout is up to 4 times more effective than hydroxychloroquin which others claim is 4 times more effective than chloroquin. The studies will make things clearer. At this time people are being treated and getting better. Lives are being saved. As far as the antivirals I'm told that remdesivir wasn't that effective against ebola but was successfully paired with hydroxychloroquin and seemed to work very well on the first very sick people to arrive in Brisbane, Qld, Aus after the year of the rat celebrations... thanks CCP....people did get better... clinical trials are underway. With modern running statistical analysis we will know soon. According to literature any of the quinine derivatives are supposed to mainly work as ionosphores, giving zinc ions a passage into cells... zinc being not a RNA virus' favourite ingredient. A small German lab team had a nucleotide based treatment similar to remdesivir ready to go to try on ebola but were pushed aside when the US Army Medical Corps arrived with their monoclonal antibodies. Since then in an effort to attract the interest of pharmaceutical investors they have worked on to produce treatment options for a wider range of RNA viruses. These new antivirals are aimed to work to stop the virus making the two big proteins which split into some sixteen different parts which make up the molecular machinery which the virus replicates itself with, not just dumping a dummy nucleotide base into the viral RNA copy to lock it as antivirals such as Remdesivir are purported to do. In other words this team out of Germany think they think they have a broad spectrum treatment against all RNA viruses known, Ebola, Cold, Corona, Hand Foot and Mouth, whatever. They may have a cure for the common cold but so far the pharmaceutical corporations don't seem to be interested. Something about not being good for the stock/share price some would say. The story goes that the lead researcher of the German team was invited to fly into China with samples of his precious molecules. He served his two weeks of quarantine but then the Chinese blew up in fury over some idiot's misreport on the internet that he had taken 'new drugs' into China to try on sick patients. He was flown out without having seen a patient. Who knows? There are lots of good stories being told about the goings on and off around this latest corona outbreak. There are a lot of tales told, misinformation, misstatements, legends and fictions galore being circulated for a variety of reasons and purposes. Conspiracies abound. Real and imagined. For instance the Chinese are well known for their spying and intellectual property theft. They would have insisted on samples to test. They could be working diligently on cures even at this moment. There's a delicious rumour circulating in spook circles (often misleadingly called 'Intelligence Agencies') that this time the low despicable detestable sneaking immoral conscienceless Chinese may have stolen a booby trap and got the lethal strain (nCOVID-19l?) of novel corona virus vintage 2019. The precise beauty of this 'fiction' as such a psyops rumour is talked about in such circles is that the Chinese have to take it seriously true or not. The Chinese spy and steal all the time. Two Harvard professors were arrested for their espionage activities for fun and profit with the Chinese. So was at least one other professor from the west coast arrested. The Canadians aren't saying much. They could be similarly embarrassed. The brilliant Chinese grad student did turn out to be a member of the PLA. Was she a stunningly gorgeous lady? That would at least fit the narrative. So far the proposed lethal strain being followed by the weaker strain to hit the target area and then protect the broader area and your own troops as you invade is straight bioweapon theory. The Chinese have two biolabs in Wuhan. One closer to the infamous wet market where live wild animals are chopped up for meat. It's cultural. The plot sickens. One Level 4 lab is further away. A Chinese study says bats are not sold or eaten in that market. Nothing on Pangolins yet. Chinese lab workers are renown for their meticulous hygiene and strict adherence to the best biohazard protection protocols. The lower paid are also often also addicted to cigarettes. Anyway mistakes happen. I make no judgement. Feel free to speculate. We have plenty of time while obediently cowering in cover. The imagination runs wild. The probability is that this new virus is a natural cross over from the lesser horseshoe bat to the pangolin to humans. Possibly recently. Chinese poor public health and hygiene habits guarantees that some new viruses will be spawned, take hold and spread. This new latest and greatest corona virus is just the next to emerge. It's just a sheer coincidence that this new corona spreads well hands to face and is so particularly dangerous for the Han in its original form. Don't believe the Chinese numbers. There are lots of stories surrounding this present mess. Good and bad. The pharmaceutical corporations are keen to push new and more expensive proprietary solutions bringing big profits for them. They would be all too keen to downplay talk of cheaper old established drug options. And have. Our testing was hopeless. The WHO worse than useless. Insurance companies run the US Hospital system. They shut down 12 Hospitals in the New York area alone over the past few years. Hospitals around the world have been paired down to the minimum for good times in an era of good public health standards. In our era blessed with peace and prosperity supply chains have been put on just in time ordering from everything from the ingredients for medicines to toilet paper...enough said. National Health Authorities are in the grip or at least heavily under the influence of the same proprietary interests all over. As is the chain of registering for new treatments. We're just not prepared for disaster. Corporate geniuses have outsourced vital industries to China. Yes, the Chinese CCP rulers did it. They're culpable. They're guilty of a lot but we did it to ourselves too. The inept efforts of Health Authorities at the start of this outbreak have been a debacle. A field medic in WWI became so desperate from over 80% of his soldiers dying from the Spanish Flu, that he began giving them hydrogen peroxide intravenously. When he hit the right ratio, he began saving over 80%. Today, some who have cancer or other serious diseases, go to clinics that remove a pint of blood from the patient, infuse food grade peroxide that's been highly diluted and put the blood back in.

Many are unaware that the body's front line of defense, our white blood cells, manufacture hydrogen peroxide and use it to fight invader cells. I began using Hydrogen Peroxide in the nineties, by putting 5-7 drops of 35% Food Grade Peroxide in an empty nebulizer cup and filling it the rest of the way with distilled water. I also purchased the cheap 2oz. brown glass bottle dropper bottles on amazon and the equally inexpensive 2.7oz Fine Mist spray bottles as well; for use as convenient, travel versions for when one does not have a nebulizer handy. I filled the dropper bottle with 35% Food Grade Peroxide then put 12-15 drops of it into an empty 2.7oz fine mist spray bottle, then filled it the rest of the way with distilled water.

This mix, which contains highly diluted and pure food grade peroxide (not the 3% brown bottle stuff you get at the drug store) and has proven HIGHLY BENEFICIAL to me and my family. On one occasion, my wife was sent home from work with bronchitis, as her boss had lung cancer and couldn't be exposed. My wife was back to work in 4 days. Her boss sent her in for a lung scan because, as a former nurse, she said it takes a month or so for bronchitis to run it's course. Lung scan was clear. Her boss tried it and her tumors stopped growing almost immediately. Since then, we have used it for all manner of flus and colds. It is important to tackle any sickness as first symptoms arise. This helps your body get the upper hand quickly. The longer invader cells are allowed to multiply, the longer and harder the battle.

As with any "antibiotic" it is beneficial to also take a probiotic, I have used a broad spectrum one called nexabiotic, to keep my beneficial gut bacteria intact.

(Obligatory disclaimer: I submit the aformentioned information as a personal account, and give no medical advice to anyone, explicit or implied.)

From the start of January to mid-March, the government had been holding back the policy to close ALL of our borders that connect Hong Kong with mainland China, and this has stemmed discontent against the government. Hoping that people coming into Hong Kong would fill in the health forms honestly, the government even stated that if people filled in the health registration forms honestly, if they contract the coronavirus, the treatment that they receive in Hong Kong would be free of charge, and even more mainlanders stormed into Hong Kong through the few borders that remained open. Many politicians in the legislative council pleaded to the government in hopes that the government would close all borders, and it was 2 weeks ago that the government finally decided to close down the border at Hong Kong International Airport, but they still kept the borders between Hong Kong and mainland China open as usual. Documents from the government even mentioned that businessmen coming in from China are exempted from quarantine, and this has fuelled more anger against the government.

After almost 9 months of anti-extradition bill protests in Hong Kong, most Hongkongers have strong distrust against the government. Amidst the current situation, we are staying at home. We are just simply trying our best to protect ourselves when the government is not able to protect its citizens. I am sure that our ability to stay at home and quarantine effectively is not correlated with our trust in our government, but our distrust against our incapable and unresponsive government.
